comments:
I am seeing this with the latest 4.4 i1 testpass 1 driver ( http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/downloads/?buildId=TPTP-4.4.0-200702190100
 )

I ran a JUnit test and then generated a BIRT Test Pass Report with a time window
that included the execution I had just run.  The report opened correctly.  However, when
I restarted Eclipse, I was unable to open the report, and I got an SWT error that said
I should restart the workbench.  

Below is the list of archives I used to set up my
install (not sure if this is relevant or not...)  They are all listed on the build page
referenced above.

wtp-I-I200702080847-200702080847.zip
birt-report-framework-2.2.0-N20070207.zip
dtp_1.0_200612211.zip
eclipse-SDK-I20070209-1006-win32.zip
emf-sdo-xsd-SDK-2.2.2.zip
GEF-runtime-I20070208-1537.zip
org.eclipse.tptp.test.auto-TPTP-4.4.0-200702190100.zip
tptp.sdk-TPTP-4.4.0-200702190100.zip

Interesting -- the error is being thrown by the HTML editor (which for some reason is the default editor associated with HTML files, not the web browser control.)  If I open the report with the web browser, it opens correctly, so it does not appear that restarting eclipse is part of the issue.  Simply opening the HTML file with the html editor appears to be enough to cause the problem

I just tried creating a blank file with an HTML extension, and I received the same error, so I assume this has nothing to do with TPTP.  I will try to find the correct bugzilla component to assign this to.

I hope this is the right component.  Using the following components:

wtp-I-I200702080847-200702080847.zip
eclipse-SDK-I20070209-1006-win32.zip

The HTML editor displays an SWT error and will not open.  I tried this in a clean workspace and an empty General Project.  Creating a blank HTML file (File -> New -> File) named sample.html results in this error being logged.  Message box is displayed prompting you to restart the workbench, and the editor is not opened (nor is the wizard dismissed.)

A workaround is already in our M5 candidate.  Bugs 162192, 173410, 173397 are also related.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 173405 ***
Closing as part of mass query to clean up old resolved bugs in untargetted milestones.
